unnormalised: New Delhi, July 26th – Unscheduled load shedding continues to plague several states across India, impacting businesses and households alike. Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced that unplanned outages are expected to persist due to a surge in demand exceeding available supply, particularly in rural areas like Vidarbha.
normalised: New Delhi, twenty sixth July – Unscheduled load shedding continues to plague several states across India, impacting businesses and households alike. Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O period L T period (M S E D C L) has announced that unplanned outages are expected to persist due to a surge in demand exceeding available supply, particularly in rural areas like Vidarbha.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, Director of the Indian Energy Forum, stated that delays in coal transportation and infrastructure upgrades are exacerbating the problem. "The demand has risen significantly, especially with the heatwave," he added. Reports indicate that residents are experiencing power cuts lasting up to 6 hours daily.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, Director of the Indian Energy Forum, stated that delays in coal transportation and infrastructure upgrades are exacerbating the problem. "The demand has risen significantly, especially with the heatwave," he added. Reports indicate that residents are experiencing power cuts lasting up to six hours daily.

unnormalised: The situation has led to increased operational costs for small businesses, many of whom rely on diesel generators for power backup, incurring additional expenses of Rs. 5000- Rs. 10,000 per day. In related news, Tata Power announced plans to invest Rs. 200 crores in renewable energy projects to alleviate the strain on the grid. The company also stated that it is looking at purchasing land measuring over 50,000 sq ft for solar farm development. The long-term solution, experts agree, lies in diversifying energy sources and strengthening transmission networks.
normalised: The situation has led to increased operational costs for small businesses, many of whom rely on diesel generators for power backup, incurring additional expenses of rupee five thousand to rupee ten thousand per day. In related news, Tata Power announced plans to invest rupee two hundred crore in renewable energy projects to alleviate the strain on the grid. The company also stated that it is looking at purchasing land measuring over fifty thousand square feet for solar farm development. The long-term solution, experts agree, lies in diversifying energy sources and strengthening transmission networks.
